remarks: Define the isomorphism predicate.  We read this as " ` H ` is an ` R ` , ` S ` isomorphism of ` A ` onto ` B ` ."  Normally, ` R ` and ` S ` are ordering relations on ` A ` and ` B ` respectively.  Definition 6.28 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 32, whose notation is the same as ours except that ` R ` and ` S ` are subscripts.  (Contributed by NM, 4-Mar-1997.)
statement:
df-isom $p |- ( H Isom R , S ( A , B ) <-> ( H : A -1-1-onto-> B /\ A. x e. A A. y e. A ( x R y <-> ( H ` x ) S ( H ` y ) ) ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d H x y $.
$d R x y $.
$d S x y $.
